subject: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,
The Minister of Finance
Federal Republic of Nigeria.
Dear Beneficiary,
Be informed that I have contacted you before introducing my good self to you that I am the current Minister of Finance Federal Republic of Nigeria, His Excellency President Bola Ahmed Tinubu mandated me to review all outstanding foreign debt which includes your fund payment file and then pay the beneficiary that met with the requirement.
With that your file was moved to my office last Friday after reviewing it, I decided to send you this email to advise you on the guide line on what you should do for your fund to be transferred to your account.
 First for me to know that you are the real beneficiary of the said amount US$10.5M, 
you are to reconfirm to me immediately your full names and address with your banking details.
Once I have the details from you I will then know that you are the real beneficiary and then we will process your fund and transfer to your bank account as this Government is out to prove to the world that we are corrupt free.
 
I await your urgent reply.
Sincerely,
Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,
The Minister of Finance
Federal Republic of Nigeria.

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
Hello Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,

Thank you for reaching out to me. It's an honor to be contacted by the Minister of Finance of the Federal Republic of Nigeria. I'm glad to hear that your government is working hard to prove its integrity to the world.

I understand that you need some information from me, but before we proceed, could you please provide more details about this foreign debt review? How was my name included in this list? And what exactly does this process entail?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Sara

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,
The Minister of Finance
Federal Republic of Nigeria.
Direct Tel: +234 813 107 3632


Dear Sir,

Your mail is received and the content well understood.

Sequel to my earlier email, Ten Million Five Hundred Thousand United States
Dollars is assigned to you and it is identified to be an inheritance and
the fund has been floating over the years but this present Government has
mandated that I should make contact with you and get your details to enable
us settle the payment to you,

There are some vital payment approval documents that you will require to
legally back up the funds transfer to you smoothly without any problems.
And I will be obtaining the documents for you.


Meanwhile, I have instructed the legal practitioner working under me to
prepare for obtaining the very important document including Ownership
Certificate in your name so that it can be emailed to you via attachment to
enable you sign it and return for final endorsement.

Once you sign the Ownership Certificate and return, the legal practitioner
will then be empowered with it to be able to secure other payment approval
documents that will legally back up your inheritance funds wire transfer.

You have to get back to me upon receipt of this email for directives. I am
attaching my work ID for identification.

Sincerely,

From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,
The Minister of Finance
Federal Republic of Nigeria.
Direct Tel: +234 813 107 3632

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your email. It's quite interesting to hear about the Ten Million Five Hundred Thousand United States Dollars that has been assigned to me. I'm curious, how did this come about? 

You mentioned some vital payment approval documents that are required for the funds transfer. Could you please elaborate on what these documents are and why they are necessary?

Also, you mentioned a legal team working under you who will prepare these documents, including an Ownership Certificate. Could you tell me more about this process and what it entails?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best wishes,
Sara

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,
The Minister of Finance
Federal Republic of Nigeria.
Direct Tel: +234 813 107 3632


Dear Sir,

Your mail is received and well noted.

The legal practitioner has just obtained the Ownership Certificate for you
to sign and return and note that the vital documents are to back up the
fund claim legally so that your country government will not question the
source of funds since it is a huge amount.

Find attached the Ownership Certificate.

Sincerely,

From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Edun,
The Minister of Finance
Federal Republic of Nigeria.
Direct Tel: +234 813 107 3632

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your prompt response, Mr. Minister. I appreciate the information you've shared with me. 

I'm curious about the process of obtaining this Ownership document. Could you please explain it to me in more detail? Also, what is the purpose of this document and how does it help in backing up the fund claim?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Sara

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
Don't be curious the process is very simple once you fill the Ownership
Certificate and return for endorsement you have done your part as the
beneficiary. With the Ownership Certificate we can secure other approval
documents for you and submit same to the authority of the paying Bank to
remit your funds. The documents will make the government of your country
not to question the source of the money.

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for explaining the process to me. It sounds quite straightforward, but I must admit, I'm not entirely familiar with these types of transactions. Could you perhaps elaborate a bit more on what the Ownership entails? And how exactly does it help in securing other approval documents?

Also, could you please clarify what you mean by "submit same to the authority of the paying Bank"? Who is this authority and how do they fit into the process?

I appreciate your patience with my questions. I just want to make sure I understand everything correctly.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

Best wishes,
Sara

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
Thank you for your email.

On the Ownership Certificate, once it is signed by you and returned to me,
it will back the legal practitioner to secure other payment approval
documents in your favor.

The Ownership Certificate atest that you are the actual fund Beneficiary.
Bank authority are the people that will verify the documents once the
documents is submitted to them and after the verification and they
confirmed that the documents are authentic, your funds will be transferred
to your account.

All you are required to do now is to fill the Ownership Certificate sign it
and send back to me as I know what to do to finalize on the funds transfer
to your account.

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
Hello,

Thank you for your email and the detailed explanation. I appreciate your guidance on this matter. 

Just to clarify, once I sign the Ownership document, it will be used to secure other payment approval documents in my favor, correct? And these documents will then be verified by the bank authority?

Could you please explain a bit more about what happens after the bank authority verifies these documents? How long does this process usually take?

Also, could you guide me on how to fill out the Ownership document? Are there any specific details that I need to pay attention to while filling it out?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Sara

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
In the Ownership Certificate you are to fill your legal names and sign
below with date.

The verification of the documents by the authority takes 24 hours from the
time it is submitted. After the authority has verified the documents and
confirmed it authentic, the said funds US$10,500,000 only will be wired to
your bank account.

subject: Re: From: Chief Adebayo Olawale Ed
body:
Hello there,

Thank you for sharing this information with me. It sounds like a straightforward process. I'm curious, though, could you please explain to me how the verification of documents by the authority works? And what kind of documents are usually required for this process?

Also, I'm wondering about the time frame. You mentioned it takes hours from submission to verification - is there a specific range we're talking about here? Like 2-3 hours or more like 8-10 hours?

I appreciate your help in understanding this better!

Best wishes,
Sara
